result.execSummary:
The defendant Danny D Walters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
With Huber and Good Time Credit.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danny D Walters

defendant.name: Walters, Danny D
defendant.address: 112 1/2 E Union Street # B, Waupaca, WI 54981

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:37 am case called. Defendant Danny D Walters in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court sentences the defendant to: 4 days WCJ with credit for 3 days served. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appleal Rights Given.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
SPD Szylagyi and Defendant, Danny Walters.

Case Called @ 1:10 PM: Defendant Danny D Walters in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  SPD has not yet rec'd a copy of the Complaint.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per ADA:  Def FTA at P/S hearing on 11/16/2015.  Per SPD:  Def stated he could not appear on the day in question and he did write to the Court.  Def was arrested prior to scheduling of Vol App.  SPD requests the Court impose further Signature Bond.  ADA argues as to bond request of $1000.00 w/conditions.  SPD would join in bond request.  The Court:  Orders $1000 Signature Bond w/no driving w/o valid DL.  Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Case called @ 2:30 p.m. Defendant Danny D Walters not in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Based on non appearance the court authorizes the issuance of a bench warrant extraditable within the State of Wisconsin. The court orders the $200 Cash Bond Forfeited. 15TR2169 - Default Judgment entered. Court orders $10 forfeiture w/ 60 DTP or PP.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

15CM-322 and 15TR-2169 - Both Cases Called @ 3:10 PM:  Defendant Danny D Walters in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def requests counsel.   He then states that he is would like to speak to the State on his own without counsel.  Court reviews abstract and believes that Def would be eligible for reinstatement with AODA completion and payment of unpaid fines.  NGP entered by Court as to both matters.   P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
